item.title: Report E-2024100423
item.description:
Report E-2024100423

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 8, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1823 was torn in transit and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Carolina Environmental Response Team, Inc. (CERT) to remediate the impacted site. CERT personnel collected the damaged bag, impacted shrink wrap, and impacted cardboard, for disposal. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas, and swept them in with hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report I-2024100115
item.description:
Report I-2024100115

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T09:15:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the top side of the pail putting a 3 inch long puncture in the pail. Pail was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the loading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the bottom side of the pail putting a 1.5 inch long punctute in the container. Container was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup

item.description:
Report X-2024101031

  • City: GREENSBORO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED TO DOOR 24 WEARING PROPER PPE. THIS PACKAGE FELL OUT OF THE TRUCK ONTO THE GROUND OUTSIDE OF THE DOOR. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND CLASS 9 RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR FUTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024100858
item.description:
Report X-2024100858

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: INSPECTION WAS DONE ON ONE AIR PACKAGE THAT FELT COLD TO THE TOUCH AND WAS MARKED PERISHABLE. PACKAGE CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS APPROXIMATELY TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NORTH CAROLINA USING UPS ACCOUNT A75Y17, VNDR, 2323 BROADWAY SUITE 207, OAKLAND CA 94612. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
